article.headline: Pennsylvania 70, Harvard 57
article.story: BOSTON (AP) --Tim Begley scored 21 points and grabbed 10 rebounds as Penn extended its winning streak to six games with a 70-57 win over Harvard on Friday. Matt Stehle led the Crimson (7-11, 2-3 Ivy) with 14 points and eight rebounds. Jim Goffredo added 10 points for Harvard. Ibrahim Jaaber scored 12 points and Eric Osmundson 10 for Penn. Penn (10-7, 3-0) took a 33-20 lead on Steve Danley's jumper with 2:47 remaining in the first half. Harvard fought back with a 15-2 run over the next four minutes and tied the score at 35-35 with 18:02 left in the second half. But Begley made two jumpers as the Quakers answered with an 11-0 run over the next four minutes and opened a 46-35 lead on two free throws by Jaaber with 14:21 left. Penn led 35-29 at halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
